main_definition: Standing refers to the physical act of being in an upright position on one's feet, as well as its various idiomatic meanings.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Physical state of a person or object that is not moving and supported by something
meanings_and_examples.example: The tree was standing tall even after the storm.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To hold, support or bear weight in an upright position
meanings_and_examples.example: She held her baby while he took his first steps to ensure it wouldn't fall.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The act of remaining firm and steadfast in one's beliefs or positions despite opposition or difficulty
meanings_and_examples.example: Despite facing criticism, she remained standing by her decision to pursue a career in the arts.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To be present at an event such as a meeting, ceremony, etc., especially when one is expected to take part or show support
meanings_and_examples.example: He was standing at the podium during the graduation ceremony.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A legal term referring to the authority granted by law for an individual to act on behalf of someone else, often in a financial matter
meanings_and_examples.example: She had the power of attorney, so she was able to stand in court and sign documents.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A position or stance that is well-known or easily recognized by others within a particular context or discussion
meanings_and_examples.example: His strong opinions on environmental issues make his views very clear – they are quite the talking point at gatherings.
